info.title: SuperOffice Agent API v1
info.termsOfService: You must be an authorized user to access this API.

post.summary: Loading default values into a new SaintConfiguration.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code.

parameters.name: SO-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code. Overrides Accept-Language value.

parameters.name: SO-Culture
parameters.description: Number, date formatting in a specified culture (iso2 language) code. Partially overrides SO-Language/Accept-Language value. Ignored if no Language set.

parameters.name: SO-TimeZone
parameters.description: Specify the timezone code that you would like date/time responses converted to.

parameters.name: SO-AppToken
parameters.description: The application token that identifies the partner app. Used when calling Online WebAPI from a server.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.SaintConfigurat.description:
Definition of the three perionds for status monitors and some other settings per saint entity
<para />
Carrier object for SaintConfiguration.
Services for the SaintConfiguration Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.ISaintAgent">Saint Agent</see>.

OwnerTable.description: The table that is the owning entity

Enabled.description: On/off switch for Saint functionality for this entity

Period1.description: Length of the first counter period

Period2.description: Length of the second counter period

Period3.description: Length of the third counter period

GenerationStart.description: When was the last regeneration started

GenerationEnd.description: When was the last regeneration finished

RowsGenerated.description: Number of CounterValue rows generated for this entity

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Security.TableRight.description:
Wraps a table right together with an explanatory reason.
Code can indicate why access is restricted.

SuperOffice.CRM.Security.FieldProperty.description: Class holding properties like field length, field type about a field in the carrier.

SuperOffice.CRM.Security.FieldRight.description:
Wraps the field right together with an explanatory reason.
Also adds logical operators to the field rights so that they can be easily combined.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.StatusMonitor.description:
Definition of all properties for a status monitor
<para />
Carrier object for StatusMonitor.
Services for the StatusMonitor Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.ISaintAgent">Saint Agent</see>.

OwnerTable.description: Id of table that owns the status monitor

Rank.description: Priority rank, in case more than one status is signalled. Lowest wins

DefaultTask.description: "Default task type for this status; the default task text is in the text table (since it can be long), and may contain template variables"

DefaultTaskText.description: Default task text for this status

IsVisual.description: Should the status be visualized (active) in the client

LastGenerated.description: When was this status last generated (i.e., statusValue rows created)

PictureId.description: Id of BinaryObject row that contains image for status monitor

NeedsUpdate.description: Is the definition dirty, ie., ALL values are invalid until a recalculation; this flag is set when the status DEFINITION is changed, as opposed to the flag on StatusValue

Deleted.description: Deleted flag, 1 if this record is deleted (never from the database)

NumMatches.description: Number of targets that have this status, this should be the number of rows in StatusValue pointing to this definition, and that have isSignalled set to 1

NumNeedUpdate.description: Number of targets that had this status, but have their needsUpdate bit set due to some change

GenerationStart.description: When was the last regeneration started

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.SaintCarr.description: GetStatusMonitors: Get all active status monitors for a specified target
GetStatusMonitor: Get a single status monitor based on its identity

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.BatchTaskInfo.description:
BatchTaskInfo contains information about one batch task.
<para />
Carrier object for BatchTaskInfo.
Services for the BatchTaskInfo Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IBatchAgent">Batch Agent</see>.

AssociateId.description: Task owner. If it is a System task, AssociateId = 0.

DetailsTable.description: Id of table with more information about the task.

DetailsRecord.description: Record Id of a row in the DetailsTable containing more info about the task.

IsSystemTask.description: If IsSystemTask is true, the task is not initiated by an associate.

IsInternalTask.description: If IsInternalTask is true, this task will not add a trace to the database.

ParameterObject.description: ParameterObject will be serialized to a binary blob and saved in the BinaryObject table. The link to the BinaryObject will be set using DetailsTable and DetailsRecord.

LastStarted.description: When was the task last started.

StartCount.description: Maps to the startcount field in the batchtask table.

DatabaseSerialNumber.description: Serial number of the database the task is to run on.

Result.description: Maps to the result field in the batchtask table.

Response.description: Maps to the response field in the batchtask table.

Request.description: Maps to the request field in the batchtask table.

ProgressDescription.description: Descriptive text for the current stage

ProgressPercent.description: Task progress, in percent of estimated total

FileName.description: The filename related to the batchtask.

CancellationBehaviour.description: Indicate if the task can be stopped.

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.SaintCarr.description: SetRankOnStatusMonitors: Set rank order on status monitors
RegenerateStatusMonitor: Regenerate the given status monitor
RegenerateCounters: Regenerate the Saint counters - this can take several minutes

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.StatusMonitorPe.description:
Obsolete, use SaintConfiguration carrier and methods instead. Was:Definition of the three perionds for status monitors
<para />
Carrier object for StatusMonitorPeriods.
Services for the StatusMonitorPeriods Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.ISaintAgent">Saint Agent</see>.

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice Password.description:
SuperOffice username:password are passed in Base64-encoded. 

You can also pass inn an unencoded ticket 7T:abc== with the HTTP Authenticate header.

SuperId Authentication.description:
SuperOffice SuperId OAuth implicit flow. 
You need to issue a request to the SuperId authorization URL
    https://online.superoffice.com/login/common/oauth/authorize?response_type=token
      &client_id=670734e0-4c5a-11e3-be9e-a171392e81db
      &redirect_uri=https://example.com/spa/

passing in the application id and redirect URL.

SuperId will log the user in, and redirect to the requested redirect URL with a #payload
containing the access token and claims. (The redirect URL must be registered with SuperId in advance)

   https://example.com/spa#access_token=8A%3aCust12227.AXRrCITpPBvQX3UbIohb
      &token_type=bearer
      &state=
      &expires_in=3600
      &ctx=Cust12227
      &netserver_url=https%3a%2f%2fsod.superoffice.com%2fCust12227%2fRemote%2fServices82%2f

You can take the #access_token value and pass it as the Authenticate HTTP header as a BEARER token.

externalDocs.description: The SuperOffice DevNet Community has more documentation, examples, and discussion forums.
